title: Anne Bonny
summary: Anne Bonny (8 March 1697 â€“ disappeared April 1721),[1][2] sometimes Anne Bonney,[3] was an Irish pirate operating in the Caribbean, and one of a few female pirates in recorded history.[4] What little that is known of her life comes largely from Captain Charles Johnson's (a possible pseudonym of Daniel Defoe) A General History of the Pyrates.
